newsitem.title: USA: LOT to add six U.S.-Poland direct flights.
newsitem.headline: LOT to add six U.S.-Poland direct flights.

text.p: LOT Polish Airlines said it will operate a total of six additional direct flights from New York and Chicago to Poland between May 15 and June 7.
Its North American marketing manager Oliver Green said the summer schedule will be operated by Boeing 767s from New York-JFK, New York-Newark International and Chicago's O'Hare airports.
The new flights are in addition to the 20 existing flights during the period.

Regional sales manager Pawel Lodzinski said the carrier, which is purchasing five additional Boeing aircraft this summer, is forecasting a good year with a 12 to 15 percent increase in cargo revenues against 1996.
Lodzinkski said the order, valued at $225 million, will see delivery of two Boeing 737s by late April, one 767 in mid-May and two further 737s by end-June.
Magorzata Budnicka, LOT cargo manager at John F. Kennedy airport, said its station handled over 3,000 metric tonnes or 33 percent system-wide business, on inbound and outbound cargo in 1996.
Budnicka said that fabrics, apparel, and paper goods were among the most frequently imported cargo in 1996.
Electronics and heavy machinery headed the list of cargo exported from the U.S. during the same period.
Via onward connections from Warsaw, Rudnicka said LOT saw "tremendous cargo traffic (potential) to all of central Europe and the Baltic republics".
Budnicka added that said the carrier is considering removing its cargo fuel surcharges. These were applied from December 8 at 10 US cents per kg.
If and when fuel costs returned to June 1996 levels, LOT would definitely remove the surcharges, she said. - Reuters Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44 171 542 7706 Fax:5017
